A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I hope Disney reads this: 

- The script felt as if dictated by commercial interests 
regarding next episodes\, potential spin offs etc. It also felt as if there was no confidence in it\, and was reworked a hundred times to a point of nonsense. 

- 57% audience approval in reality is much lower. I went out of the cinema and everyone seemed disappointed. Many people think they liked it because they were influenced by early reviews. 

- When Luke says "This is not going to go the way you think"\, I was bracing for massive impactful moments. But all felt safe and self aware and calculated... in Star Wars movies there are moments I sometimes cry... here the feelings felt forced. It's the first Star Wars movie I don't feel like rewatching. 

-Why not Christopher Nolan or Spielberg to direct? Why these directors with previous movies that I find so uninspired? I didn't find TFA bad at all\, and I consider Rogue One very good\, especially its last few minutes.

-Huge waste of the potentiality for cinematic drama in the mishandling of Luke... What ? He didn't even bother to go and fight ( I don't care that it made sense)??? And died anyway? Wow... thanks Rian.

-
